Tucson continues to wait patiently for Rodimus to make his move.  If he wer=
e to strike the first blow he knew he'd be putting himself on the same leve=
l as a Decepticon.  True he had hidden from Hydras and his merry men, and t=
hat was not indicative of Optimus yet a little bit of originality of Tucson=
, but, Tucson realized that this was serious and it had to be handled as su=
ch.  His all wheel drive systems quickly kick in to give him strength in hi=
s legs, feet arms and hands.  And now he takes on the same defensive poses =
as Optimus had taken when battling against Megatron.  It would almost seem =
as if Optimus were really reincarnated in Tucson, yet that was not the case=
.
He thinks to himself once again.

" I'm sure you wouldn't have wanted to =
do this either Optimus, and I can see why that sometimes the hardest lesson=
s are learned when you face an enemy upon who has been your comrade for man=
y years.  But if this were you, I trust you would do the same."

He keeps h=
is ears on his opponent, and his sensors at the ready.  The feeling inside =
him grows stronger and soon, he feels metallic plates shifting once again, =
putting him in battle mode, with a shield over his face.  He had not ever e=
xperienced the change into battle mode quite like this, which now has him a=
ppearing a lot like Optimus yet smaller in size.

" All right, have it your=
 way Rodimus.  This is going to hurt me more than it will hurt you."

>   
> Tu=
cson nodds. And for the first time, even though he could not see from his e=
yes, it appears that he looks Rodimus in the eyes, as Optimus would have do=
ne with Megatron many years ago. His expression stoic, as was Optimus Prime=
, and then out of nowhere he gives his reply.
> 
> " It doesn't have to com=
e to this, Rodimus, but you leave me with no choice. One shall rise, and on=
e shall fall." 
> 
> His voice had always sounded like Optimus when he was =
his age. But now, at this moment, it sounded more and more like the legenda=
ry Autobot leader. Now something inside him was coming alive. A spirit that=
 he had kept deep down within him and now it was emerging. He did not cower=
 in shock at the thought of going toe to toe with Rodimus, although not thr=
illed with the idea, as Optimus would have felt the same way, going against=
 one of his own, but he knew it had to be done. Perhaps it was the first st=
ep in hopefully recovering his lost leader.
> 
> " It's clear to me that yo=
u have chosen the same path Megatron chose years ago. A path that lead to h=
is demise. So, if this is the path you wish to take, then I fight you as an=
 enemy."
> 
> His eyes do not narrow in rage, but take on a look of concent=
ration. He'd need it if he was going to go against Rodimus.
> 
> " I'm read=
y."
> 
> --- In nbwrpg@yahoogroups.com, Super Cyclonus <supercyclonus@> wro=
te:
> >
> > 
> > >" Nothing comes easy, and I'm aware of that. I'm not here=
 to take the easy way out. I said I'd do anything it took to restore my lea=
der, and I am willing to stand by my pledge, no matter the cost to my own s=
park. So if it means comming dangerously close to my own mortality, I accep=
t the challenge. I am willing to fight anyone who wishes to challenge me, a=
nd I pledge to fight in Warrior's honor." 
> > >
> > >He waits to find out =
who will take him up on his offer.
> > 
> > "Autobot" Scourge's dark tones =
move across the room as he watches Tuscon with narrow and dangerous optics,=
 "You stand in the middle of Hydras' throne, sneaking in here like a tubo-r=
at, attacking from the back, and you ask us for honor?" 
> > 
> > Cyclonus =
nodded, "You ask for what you yourself are not ready to give." Cyclonus ste=
pped foward, his optics glowing, his hands dropping to his sides and a dece=
ptivly relaxed 'ready stance', "Yet if it is a battle you desire, then you =
shall have it."
> > 
> > "NO!" Rodimus' voice barked out as he stepped fowa=
rd, his optics bright and his weapon ready! "It is me he came for, and it i=
s *I* who will give him this battle."
> > 
> > Cyclonus glanced back at Rod=
imus, the slightest hint of annoyance sketching itself across his face for =
a moment. 
> > 
> > "Let the boy take him" Scourge said as he stepped neare=
r to Cyclonus, a sly smile appearing on his face, "It will lets us know wha=
t he's made of."
> > 
> > Cyclonus paused for a moment and then nodded, ges=
turing for Rodimus to step foward. "He is yours."
> > 
> > Rodimus, after a=
 slightly worried glance at Scourge and then Cyclonus, as if he was only ju=
st now realizing something, stepped foward to face his new opponant. 
> > 
=
> > "I shall give you all the honor you have given us *Autobot!*" He said, =
That last word comming out almost as a curse. With all thoughts of any conf=
usion on his part lost in his readiness for battle the Dark Rodimus gesture=
d to Tuscon, "Come, come to your doom!"
